decision_conditions: The proposal, by reason of the loss of a retail unit within the secondary shopping area of the Eastcote Town Centre and the use proposed, would erode the retail function of the area, harming the vitality and viability of the centre. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policy DMTC 2 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two Development Management Policies (March 2019) and Policies 2.15 and 4.9 of the London Plan (2016).

The proposal, by reason of the rear roof lantern and the design of the new shopfront would be detrimental to the architectural composition of the original property, and character, appearance and visual amenities of the street scene and would fail to either preserve or enhance the character or appearance of the surrounding Eastcote, Morford Way Conservation Area. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policies BE1 and HE1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part One - Strategic Policies (November 2012), Policies DMHB 1, DMHB 4 and DMHB 13 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part Two - Development Management Policies (March 2019) Policy 7.8 of the London Plan (2016) and the NPPF.

The decision to REFUSE planning permission has been taken having regard to all relevant planning legislation, regulations, guidance, circulars and Council policies, including The Human Rights Act (1998) (HRA 1998) which makes it unlawful for the Council to act incompatibly with Convention rights, specifically Article 6 (right to a fair hearing); Article 8 (right to respect for private and family life); Article 1 of the First Protocol (protection of property) and Article 14 (prohibition of discrimination).
description: Change of use of No.178 from retail (Use Class A1) to restaurant (Use Class A3), single storey infill extension, installation of rooflight and installation of new shop front to both units
